extra.yt_auth_required:
Failed to download: YouTube requires authentication.

*Solutions:*
1. *Google Auth (Recommended):* Use `.gauth auth` to link your Google account.
2. *YT_COOKIE:* Set the `YT_COOKIE` environment variable.
Wiki: https://github.com/lyfe00011/levanter/wiki/yt%E2%80%90cookie

*Error:* {0}
extra.group_cmd: This command is only available in group chats.
extra.no_contacts: not found contacts, please add contacts
extra.lang_not_supported: ' {0} ' language not supported yet, switching to default language.

common.update: _Settings updated successfully! Your preferences have been saved and are now active._

afk.example:
> *AFK Usage:*
- Set AFK: *afk [reason]*
- Example: *afk I am busy* Last seen #lastseen ago
- Sending a message automatically removes AFK status
- Disable AFK: *afk off*

alive.desc: Display the bot's alive status message with optional custom text.

antifake.example:
*Antifake Status:* {0}

> *Command Usage:*
- *antifake list* - View current mode and codes
- *antifake allow 1,91* - Whitelist Mode: Allow these codes, block all others
- *antifake disallow 92,93* - Blacklist Mode: Block these codes, allow all others
- *antifake remove 91* - Remove code from list
- *antifake clear* - Clear all codes and disable
- *antifake on | off* - Enable/Disable

> *Note:* Cannot mix whitelist and blacklist modes. Use `clear` to switch modes.
antifake.desc: Enable or configure anti-fake number (whitelist or blacklist mode)
antifake.allow_prompt:
*Please provide country codes to allow (whitelist mode)*
_Example: antifake allow 1,91_
antifake.disallow_prompt:
*Please provide country codes to disallow (blacklist mode)*
_Example: antifake disallow 92,93_
antifake.remove_prompt:
*Please provide country codes to remove*
_Example: antifake remove 91_
antifake.mode_conflict_whitelist:
*‚ö†Ô∏è Cannot mix modes!*

_You are currently in Blacklist Mode. Use `antifake clear` first to switch to Whitelist Mode._
antifake.mode_conflict_blacklist:
*‚ö†Ô∏è Cannot mix modes!*

_You are currently in Whitelist Mode. Use `antifake clear` first to switch to Blacklist Mode._

antilink.antilink_notset: Antilink is configured to block all links (no URL list set). Use 'antilink allow' or 'antilink disallow' to configure specific URLs.
antilink.example:
Antilink Status: *{0}*

> Usage Examples:
- antilink list - View current settings
- antilink allow whatsapp.com - Allow specific URLs
- antilink disallow facebook.com - Disallow specific URLs
- antilink clear allow - Clear allowed URLs
- antilink clear disallow - Clear disallowed URLs
- antilink on | off - Enable/Disable antilink
- antilink kick | warn | null - Set action for link
antilink.no_new_urls: *No new URLs to add.* All URLs already exist in the list.
antilink.urls_updated:
*Allowed URLs updated*

Added: {0}
Total: {1} URL(s)

_Note: URLs are case-insensitive_
antilink.no_disallowed_urls: *No new URLs to disallow.* All URLs are already disallowed.
antilink.disallowed_updated:
*Disallowed URLs updated*

Added to blocklist: {0}
Total blocked: {1} URL(s)

_Note: URLs are case-insensitive_

antiword.desc: Filter specific words in the group chat
antiword.example:
AntiWord Status: {0}
> *Usage Examples:*
- antiword kick | warn | null - Set action for violations
- antiword on | off - Enable/Disable word filtering
- antiword add word1,word2 - Add words to block list
- antiword remove word1,word2 - Remove words from block list
- antiword list - View blocked words

apk.example:
> *Usage Examples:*
- apk Mixplorer
- apk whatsapp,apkm (includes bundle APKs)

delete.example:
> *Usage Examples:*
- delete p - Send deleted messages to your chat/sudo
- delete g - Send deleted messages in the same group
- delete off - Disable anti-delete
- delete <jid> - Send deleted messages to a specific JID
delete.dlt_msg_sudo: _Deleted messages will be sent to your chat or sudo._
delete.dlt_msg_chat: _Deleted messages will be sent to the chat itself._

fb.invalid: *Error:* _No video found for the given URL._

fancy.desc: Creates fancy text from given text
fancy.example:

fancy <text>
fancy <font_number> (reply to a message)

*Example:*
- fancy Hello
- fancy 7 (while replying to a message)
fancy.invalid:
*Invalid Font Number!*
Please enter a number between *1-47*.

> *Example:*
- filter hi (while replying a text message)
- filter list (Shows current filters)

forward.desc: Forward replied message to specified JID(s)

greet.setexample: > *Example:* setgreet Hi, this is a bot. My boss will reply shortly.
greet.notsetgreet: > No greeting message has been set.

greetings.welcome_desc: Send a welcome message to new members
greetings.welcome_example:
Welcome is currently *{0}*

> *Usage Examples:*
- welcome Hi &mention! Welcome to &name - Set welcome message
- welcome on | off - Enable/Disable
- welcome delete - Delete message

> *Placeholders:*
- &mention - Mention new member
- &name - Group name
- &desc - Group description
- &size - Member count
- &pp - Member's profile picture

> *Media:* Reply to image/video OR include URL in message

For more details: https://levanter.site/
greetings.welcome_not_set:
_Please set a welcome message first!_

> *Example:*
welcome Hi &mention! Welcome to &name

Then use: welcome on
greetings.goodbye_desc: Send a goodbye message to members
greetings.goodbye_example:
Goodbye is currently *{0}*

> *Usage Examples:*
- goodbye Bye &mention! See you later - Set goodbye message
- goodbye on | off - Enable/Disable
- goodbye delete - Delete message

> *Placeholders:*
- &mention - Mention leaving member
- &name - Group name
- &desc - Group description
- &size - Member count
- &pp - Member's profile picture

> *Media:* Reply to image/video OR include URL in message

For more details: https://levanter.site/
greetings.goodbye_not_set:
_Please set a goodbye message first!_

> *Example:*
goodbye Bye &mention! Thanks for being with us

Then use: goodbye on

groq.example:
*Example:* groq Hi

You can optionally set the following environment variables:
- GROQ_API_KEY
- GROQ_MODEL
- GROQ_SYSTEM_MSG

For more details, visit: https://console.groq.com/keys

kick.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't remove members.
kick.mention_user: Please mention a user or reply to their message.
kick.admin: The specified user is an admin and cannot be removed.
kick.kicking_all: Kicking all non-admin members... ({0} members). Restart the bot if you want to stop.

add.warning: > Avoid adding numbers that aren't saved in contacts; this can increase the risk of being banned.
add.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't add members.
add.invalid_number: Please provide a valid phone number. Example: add 91987654321
add.failed: Failed to add. An invite has been sent instead.

promote.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't modify roles.
promote.mention_user: Please mention a user or reply to their message.
promote.already_admin: The user is already an admin.

demote.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't modify roles.
demote.mention_user: Please mention a user or reply to their message.
demote.not_admin_user: The user is not an admin.

invite.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't generate an invite link.

mute.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't change group settings.

unmute.desc: Makes Group All participants can send Message
unmute.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't change group settings.

join.invalid_link: Please provide a valid WhatsApp group invite link.
join.group_full: The group is full and cannot accept new members.

revoke.not_admin: I'm not an admin, so I can't revoke the invite link.

group_info.invalid_link: Please provide a valid WhatsApp invite link.

common_members.desc: Show or kick common memebers in two or more groups
common_members.common_usage:
*Example*
common jid
common jid kick
common jid1 jid2
common jid1,jid2 kick
common jid1 jid2 jid3...jid999

common jid1 jid2 jid3 any
kick - to remove only group u command
kickall - to remove from all jids
any - to include two or more common group members
skip - to avoid removing from all, example skip to avoid from one group or skip jid1,jid2,jid3 to skip from.

insta.desc: Download Instagram posts, reels, and videos.

ison.desc: Check if a phone number is registered on WhatsApp.

lydia.usage:
Usage: lydia on | off
Reply or mention to activate for a specific user.
lydia.note: This only works from a reply message.
lydia.desc: Enable or disable the chatbot feature.

rotate.usage: Example: rotate right|left|flip (reply to a video).
rotate.not_found: Please reply to a video and specify a valid rotation direction (right, left, or flip).
rotate.desc: Rotate a video to the right, left, or flip it.

mp3.usage: Reply to a video or audio to convert it to MP3.
mp3.not_found: Please reply to a video or audio message.
mp3.desc: Convert a video to audio or an audio clip to a voice note.

photo.usage: Reply to a photo sticker to convert it to an image.
photo.desc: Convert a sticker into an image.

reverse.usage: Reply to a video or audio to reverse its playback.
reverse.not_found: Please reply to a video or audio message.
reverse.desc: Reverse the playback of a video or audio clip.

cut.usage: Example: cut 0;30 (start;duration) (reply to a video or audio).
cut.not_found: Please reply to a video or audio with valid start and duration values (e.g., 10;30).
cut.desc: Cut a segment from an audio or video file.

trim.not_found: Please reply to a video with valid start and duration values (e.g., 60;30).
trim.desc: Trim a video between specified start and duration times.

page.not_found: Please reply to an image with a numeric caption indicating the page number.
page.desc: Add an image as a page to a PDF document.

pdf.usage: Example: pdf note (provide a title for the PDF).
pdf.not_found: Please provide a title for the PDF document.
pdf.desc: Convert images to a PDF document.

merge.usage: Example: merge 1 (reply with an order number to a video).
merge.not_found: Please reply to a video with a valid order number.

compress.usage: Reply to a video to compress it.
compress.desc: Compress a video file to reduce its size.

bass.usage: Example: bass 10 (reply to an audio or video).
bass.desc: Alter the bass levels of an audio file.

treble.usage: Example: treble 10 (reply to an audio or video).
treble.desc: Alter the treble levels of an audio file.

histo.usage: Reply to an audio or video to generate a histogram video.
histo.desc: Convert audio to a visual video histogram.

vector.usage: Reply to an audio or video to create a vector visualization video.
vector.desc: Convert audio to a vector visualization video.

crop.not_found: Please reply to a video with valid crop dimensions in the format: out_w,out_h,x,y.
crop.desc: Crop a video to the specified dimensions.
crop.xcrop:
Video width: *{0}*, height: *{1}*
Choose output size in between.

low.usage: Reply to an audio or video to lower the pitch.
low.desc: Alter the audio pitch to a lower tone.

pitch.usage: Reply to an audio or video to adjust the pitch.
pitch.not_found: Please reply to an audio or video message.
pitch.desc: Adjust the pitch of an audio file.

avec.usage: Reply to an audio or video to convert it into a video format.
avec.not_found: Please reply to an audio or video message.
avec.desc: Convert an audio clip into a video.

avm.usage: Reply with both audio and video to merge them.
avm.desc: Merge audio and video files into one.

black.usage: Reply to an audio or video to generate a video with a black background.
black.desc: Convert an audio clip into a video with a black background.

mediafire.not_found: File not found. Please verify the URL and try again.

mention.usage:
Example: mention on | off | get
(Reply to a message to target a specific user.)
mention.desc: Configure and manage the mention feature for automated replies.
mention.current_status: Mention is {0}. For details, visit: https://levanter.site/

status.usage: Usage: status on | off | no-dl | except-view <jid,...> | only-view <jid,...>
status.desc: Automatically manage the viewing of WhatsApp statuses.

read.desc: Enable or disable auto-reading of incoming messages.

online.desc: Keep your account status always online.

movie.not_found: Movie not found. Please verify the title and try again.
movie.desc: Fetch detailed movie information, including the full plot, from the OMDB API.

msgs.desc: Display the group's message count for each member, including individual totals and last seen duration.

reset.desc: Reset the message count for either the entire group or a specific member.

inactive.usage:
> Examples:
-inactive day 10
- inactive day 10 kick
- inactive total 100
- inactive total 100 kick
- inactive day 7 total 150
- inactive day 7 total 150 kick

if kick not mentioned, Just list
inactive.desc: Identify or remove inactive members based on message count or inactivity duration. Append 'kick' to remove members.

amute.usage:
Usage: amute <hour> <min>
- amute on | off
- amute info

Reply with text to set a mute message
amute.desc: Schedule automatic group muting at a specified time with an optional custom message.
amute.invalid_format:
> Example:
- amute 6 0
- amute on | off
- amute info

Reply with text to set a mute message.

aunmute.usage:
Usage: aunmute <hour> <min>
- aunmute on | off
- aunmute info
Reply with text to set an unmute message
aunmute.desc: Schedule automatic group unmuting at a specified time with an optional custom message.
aunmute.invalid_format:
> Example:
- aunmute 16 30
- aunmute on | off
- aunmute info

Reply with text to set an unmute message.

zushi.usage:
> Example:
- zushi ping, sticker
- To set all commands, type 'list' and then reply with the copied message (e.g., zushi copied_message).
zushi.desc: Allows you to enable specific commands for use by others in the chat.
zushi.no_input:

üìù Examples:

yami.desc: Displays the list of commands that are currently allowed in this chat.
yami.not_set: No allowed commands have been set yet.
yami.no_commands:

üí° Use .zushi to add commands
üìù Example: .zushi song video sticker

ope.usage: Example: ope ping, sticker OR ope all

ope.all_removed: All allowed commands have been removed.

pdm.desc: Enable or disable automatic notifications for promote/demote events in the group.
pdm.not_found: Please specify 'on' or 'off'. For example: pdm on

pinterest.not_found: No media found. Please check the URL and try again.

plugin.desc: Install external plugins by providing a Gist URL containing the plugin code, or list all installed plugins.
plugin.invalid: Please provide a valid plugin URL or plugin name.

remove.desc: Delete external plugins by specifying the plugin name or remove all installed plugins.

reboot.desc: Restart the bot instance using PM2.

jid.desc: Returns the JID of a user or chat. It checks for a mentioned user, a reply message, or defaults to the current chat's JID.

left.desc: Leaves the current group. If additional text is provided, it will be sent before leaving.

block.usage: Example: block (reply to or mention a user)

unblock.usage: Example: unblock (reply to or mention a user)

pp.desc: Updates your profile picture using the image from the replied message.

whois.name: *Name :* {0}
whois.desc: Displays the profile picture and additional information (e.g., about, status) of a user or group.

gjid.desc: Lists all group JIDs along with their group names.

qr.usage: Example: qr test  OR  reply to a QR image with qr
qr.desc: Generate a QR code from the provided text or decode a QR code from a replied image.

reddit.desc: Downloads a video from the specified Reddit post using the provided URL.
reddit.error: No video found for the given URL.

rmbg.desc: Removes the background from the replied image using the remove.bg API
rmbg.key: To use this command, ensure you have signed up at remove.bg, verified your account, copied your API key, and set it using .setvar RMBG_KEY:<your_api_key> (e.g., .setvar RMBG_KEY:GWQ6jVy9MBpfYF9SnyG8jz8P). SIGNUP: https://accounts.kaleido.ai/users/sign_up | API KEY: https://www.remove.bg/dashboard#api-key
rmbg.error: Missing API key or image. Please set your API key and reply to an image.

setschedule.usage:
> *Example :*
- setschedule jid,min-hour-day-month (in 24 hour format, day and month optional)
- setschedule tomorrow at 10am (Natural Language Support)
- setschedule every day at 10am (Repeating)
- setschedule 0-10 (Defaults to 'once' for current chat)
setschedule.desc: Schedule a message using natural language (e.g., 'tomorrow at 10am') or cron-like format. Defaults to 'once' for the current chat.
setschedule.invalid: Invalid schedule format or time. Please follow one of the examples provided.
setschedule.no_reply: Please reply to the message that you want to schedule for sending.

getschedule.desc: Retrieve all scheduled messages for the specified chat.

delschedule.desc: Delete a scheduled message by specifying the target JID and time, or remove all scheduled messages.
delschedule.invalid: Invalid format. Please follow one of the examples.

setstatus.usage: Example: setstatus jid,jid,jid,... OR setstatus contact
setstatus.desc: Set a WhatsApp status for specific contacts or for imported contacts. Reply to a message (text, image, or video) to set the status.
setstatus.reply_required: Please reply to a message to set the status.

scstatus.usage:
Examples:
- scstatus jid,jid,jid,...|min-hour-day-month (day and month optional)
- scstatus contact|min-hour-day-month
- scstatus delete all|min-hour-day-month
- scstatus list
scstatus.desc: Schedule a WhatsApp status to be sent at a specified time. Use 'contact' for imported contacts or provide specific JIDs.
scstatus.reply_required: Please reply to a message to schedule the status.
scstatus.invalid: Invalid format. Please follow one of the examples provided.

antispam.desc: Manage antispam protection with configurable levels
antispam.disabled_status:
üìä *Antispam Status*

üî¥ Disabled

Use `antispam on` to enable protection
antispam.deactivated:
‚ö†Ô∏è *Antispam Protection Disabled*

Spam detection is now OFF
antispam.invalid_level: ‚ùå Invalid level. Use: low, medium, high
antispam.help:
üìñ *Antispam Help*

*Commands:*
‚Ä¢ `antispam on` - Enable (default: medium)
‚Ä¢ `antispam off` - Disable
‚Ä¢ `antispam <low/medium/high>` - Change sensitivity
‚Ä¢ `antispam <warn/delete/kick>` - Change action
‚Ä¢ `antispam info` - View current settings

*Levels:*
‚Ä¢ Low - Relaxed (active groups)
‚Ä¢ Medium - Balanced (recommended)
‚Ä¢ High - Strict (problem groups)

sticker.desc: Convert an image or video to a sticker. Reply to an image or video message to generate a sticker.
sticker.reply_required: Please reply to an image or video.

circle.desc: Convert an image into a circular sticker.

take.usage: Example: take <title,artists,url> (reply to a sticker or audio). For audio, title is required; artists and URL are optional.
take.desc: Change the sticker pack by updating its metadata. If replying to a sticker, update its pack metadata. If replying to audio, add metadata (title, artists, URL) to the file.
take.reply_required: Please reply to a sticker or audio message.
take.additional_info: For audio metadata, the artists or URL are optional.

mp4.desc: Convert an animated sticker (WebP) into an MP4 video.
mp4.reply_required: Please reply to an animated sticker.

story.usage: Example: story <username> (or reply to a message containing the username)
story.desc: Download Instagram stories for the specified username. If multiple stories are available, a list will be provided for selection.
story.not_found: No stories found for the provided username.
story.list: Total {0} stories available. Please select one to download.

tag.usage: Example: tag all | tag admin | tag notadmin | tag <custom message> (or reply to a message with 'tag')
tag.desc: Tag members in the group based on your choice. Use 'all' to mention every member, 'admin' to mention only group admins, 'notadmin' to mention non-admin members, or provide a custom message to be sent along with the mentions.

tictactoe.usage:
Example: tictactoe <opponent_jid> OR tictactoe normal <opponent_jid> OR tictactoe restart <opponent_jid> OR tictactoe end
Default mode is infinite, use 'tictactoe normal' for normal mode.
tictactoe.desc: Play a TicTacToe game against an opponent. Challenge a user by mentioning them, replying to their message, or specifying their JID. Use 'tictactoe end' to finish the game and 'tictactoe restart <opponent_jid>' to restart with a new opponent. Default mode is infinite, use 'tictactoe normal' for normal mode.
tictactoe.choose_opponent: Please choose an opponent by replying to a message or mentioning a user. You cannot play against yourself.
tictactoe.game_restarted: Game restarted with the new opponent.
tictactoe.invalid_input: Invalid input. Please provide a valid opponent or use 'end' or 'restart' appropriately.

tiktok.usage: Usage: tiktok <TikTok URL> (or reply to a message with the URL)
tiktok.desc: Download a TikTok video from the provided URL.
tiktok.not_found: Video not found. Please verify the URL and try again.

tog.desc: Enable or disable a bot command.
tog.invalid: Invalid input. Use: tog <command> on|off (e.g., tog ping off)
tog.self_reference: Did you really want to kill me?

trt.usage: Example: trt ml hi OR trt ml (reply to a text message)
trt.desc: Translate text using Google Translate. Specify the target language code (and optionally the source language code) when replying to a message.

twitter.usage: Example: twitter <Twitter URL> (or reply to a message containing the URL)
twitter.desc: Download a Twitter video. If multiple quality options are available, you'll be prompted to choose one.
twitter.not_found: No video found for the provided Twitter URL.

upload.usage: Example: upload <URL> (or reply to a message containing a URL)
upload.desc: Download media from a provided URL. For shortened Google Images URLs, the direct image URL is retrieved automatically.

url.usage: Example: url OR url imgur (reply to an image or video)
url.desc: Convert an image or video to a URL. Optionally, specify a parameter (e.g., 'imgur') to get the URL from a specific service.

getvar.desc: Display the value of a variable. Provide the variable key (case-insensitive) to retrieve its value.

delvar.desc: Delete a variable by specifying its key.

setvar.desc: Set a variable with a specific key and value. Use '=' to separate the key from the value.

allvar.desc: Display all stored variables in sorted order.

vote.usage:
> Example :
vote q|What your favorite color?
o|üòÄ|Blue
o|üòä|Red
vote.desc: Initiate a vote in a WhatsApp group.
vote.notes: If no recipients are specified, the vote message will simply be sent to the current group.
vote.delete_vote: Delete the current vote to set a new one.
vote.vote: React or reply option to vote.

warn.usage: Example: warn @user OR warn reset @user. You can also reply to a user's message and type 'warn' or 'warn reset'.
warn.desc: Warn a user in the group chat. This command increases a user's warning count. If the count exceeds the limit, the user will be kicked from the group. Use 'warn reset' to clear a user's warnings.
warn.reset_usage: Example: warn reset @user (or reply to a user's message and type 'warn reset').
warn.kick_default: {0} has been kicked for exceeding warn limit.

wcg.usage:
Examples:
- wcg start (force start the word chain game)
- wcg end (end the current game)
Default mode is easy.
wcg.desc: Word Chain Game: continue the word chain by submitting a word. use 'wcg start' to force start and 'wcg end' to stop.
wcg.not_in_list: _This word is not in my list_
wcg.winner:
@{0} won the game üèÜ
Words : *{1}*
Longest word : *{2} ({3})* by @{4} üìö
Time : *{5}* ‚è±Ô∏è
wcg.starting:
üéÆ Game starting...
üë• Need 2 or more players
‚è≥ You have 60 seconds to join ‚è≥
üß© Mode {0}
wcg.terminated: _Not enough players to start. Game terminated._

wrg.usage:
Examples:
- wrg start (force start the random word game)
- wrg hard (start in hard mode)
- wrg easy (start in easy mode)
- wrg end (end the current game)
wrg.desc: Random Word Game: Engage in a game where you submit words in response to a random prompt. Use 'wrg start' to begin a new game or 'wrg end' to finish the game.

yts.desc: Search for YouTube videos by query or URL. If a valid YouTube URL is provided, detailed information for the first video is returned.

song.usage: Example: song indila love story OR song <YouTube URL> (reply to a message is also supported)
song.desc: Download a song from YouTube. If a URL is provided, the song is downloaded directly; otherwise, a search is performed and a list of results is generated for selection.
song.not_found: No song found for the provided query or URL.

video.usage: Example: video 720p <YouTube URL> OR video <YouTube URL>
video.desc: Download a YouTube video. You can optionally specify quality (e.g., 720p, 1080p). Default is 480p.
video.not_found: No video found for the provided query or URL.

update.desc: Check for new updates. Displays available updates or confirms that the bot is up-to-date.

update_now.desc: Update the bot to the latest version.
update_now.up_to_date: Bot is already up-to-date. No updates available.

antigm.usage:
> Usage:
- antigm on | off ‚Äî Enable or disable anti group mention
- antigm delete | warn | kick ‚Äî Set action when someone mentions the group
- antigm ignore jid,jid,... ‚Äî Ignore anti group mention from specific groups
antigm.action: Action updated: group mentions will now result in *{0}*.
antigm.filter: Ignore JIDs updated for anti group mention.
antigm.enabled: Anti group mention has been enabled.
antigm.disabled: Anti group mention has been disabled.

reminder.desc: Add a reminder to Google Calendar (natural language supported).
reminder.usage:
*Reminder Command Usage:*

- reminder <text> (add event)
- reminder list (view upcoming)
- reminder del <id> (delete event)
- Example: `reminder tomorrow at 10am meeting`
reminder.auth_required:
*Authentication Required:*

Use "gauth" to authorize the bot.
reminder.short_id_info: *Note:* You only need to enter the first 2-4 characters of the ID for the delete command.

gauth.desc: Manage Google Authentication (Authenticate, Import, Logout, Status). Optional for YouTube but required for premium features.
gauth.usage:
*Google Auth Commands:*

- `.gauth auth` ‚Äî Start the authentication process.
- `.gauth code <url_or_code>` ‚Äî Validate the authentication code.
- `.gauth import` ‚Äî Import `credentials.json` (Reply to the file).
- `.gauth status` ‚Äî Check current authentication status.
- `.gauth logout` ‚Äî Clear credentials and tokens for this session.

*Note:* Google Auth is optional for general YouTube features but required for age-restricted videos and Google Drive/Calendar/Tasks integrations.
gauth.prompt:
*Google Authentication Setup Guide:*

1. *Create Project:* Go to https://console.cloud.google.com/, click "Select a project" > "New Project", name it "Levanter" and click "Create".
2. *Enable APIs:* Go to "APIs & Services" > "Library". Search and enable "Google Drive API", "Google Calendar API" and "Google Tasks API".
3. *OAuth Consent:* Go to "APIs & Services" > "OAuth consent screen". Choose "External", fill required fields, and in the "Audience" section, add your email to "Test users" (MANDATORY).
4. *Credentials:* Go to "APIs & Services" > "Credentials". Click "Create Credentials" > "OAuth client ID". Select "Desktop app" as the application type, name it, and click "Create".
5. *Download:* Beside your new Client ID, click the Download (JSON) icon. Save it and use `.gauth import` by replying to the file.
6. *Authorize:* Now click the link below to authorize:
{0}

7. *Complete:* Log in, accept the "Unverified app" warning (Click "Advanced" > "Go to Levanter"), copy the full URL from the bar after redirect, and send:
`.gauth code <copied_url>`
gauth.import_success: `credentials.json` imported successfully! Now use `.gauth auth` to authorize.
gauth.status_not_auth: *Status:* Not authenticated for session. Use `.gauth auth`.
gauth.logout: Logged out and cleared Google Auth data for session.

gdrive.list_empty: No files found in Levanter folder.
gdrive.invalid_id: Please provide a valid file ID.
gdrive.url_prompt:
Please provide a valid URL, tag a media message, or use subcommands: list, del <id>, dl <id>.
Example: `gupload list`
gdrive.short_id_info: *Note:* You only need to enter the first 2-4 characters of the ID for download or delete commands.

task.usage: Usage: task <list | list-lists | list-switch <name> | add <text> | del <id> | done <id> | update <id> <text> | <text>>
task.auth_required: Please authenticate using *.gauth auth* and enable Google Tasks permissions.
